ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي ظَلَمْتُ نَفْسِي ظُلْمًا كَثِيرًا وَلاَ يَغْفِرُ الذُّنُوبَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ فَاغْفِرْ لِي مَغْفِرَةً مِنْ عِنْدِكَ وَارْحَمْنِي إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ الْغَفُورُ الرَّحِيمُ
EngText: Allahuma 'niny zalamtu nafsi zulman kathiran wala yaghfir zunuba 'illa 'anta faghfirli maghfiratan min indika war hamni 'innaka 'antal ghafoorur raheem
EngTranslation: O Allah, I have wronged my soul a great deal, and I will not forgive my sins but you.
UrduTranslation: اے اللہ ! میں نے اپنی جان پر ( گناہ کر کے ) بہت زیادہ ظلم کیا پس گناہوں کو تیرے سوا کوئی دوسرا معاف کرنے والا نہیں ۔ مجھے اپنے پاس سے بھرپور مغفرت عطا فرما اور مجھ پر رحم کر کہ مغفرت کرنے والا اور رحم کرنے والا بیشک وشبہ تو ہی ہے ۔
Chapter: Chapter: Invocation before the Taslim

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْكَسَلِ وَالْهَرَمِ، وَالْمَأْثَمِ وَالْمَغْرَمِ، وَمِنْ فِتْنَةِ الْقَبْرِ وَعَذَابِ الْقَبْرِ، وَمِنْ فِتْنَةِ النَّارِ وَعَذَابِ النَّارِ، وَمِنْ شَرِّ فِتْنَةِ الْغِنَى، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ فِتْنَةِ الْفَقْرِ، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ فِتْنَةِ الْمَسِيحِ الدَّجَّالِ،
EngText: Allahumma inni a'udhu bika minal kasali wal harami, wal maasami wal-maghrami,  wamin fitnatil-qabr, wa 'adhabil-qabr, wamin fitnatin naar  wa 'adhabin-naar, wamin sharri fitnatil ghina wa a'udhu bika min fitnatil-faqri wa a'udhu bika min  fitnatil maseeh-dajjal
EngTranslation: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from From laziness and arrogance, And the sinful and the wronged,, and trial of the grave and the torment of the grave, from the trials of fire and the torment of Hell, and from the evil temptation of riches, and I seek refuge in You from the affliction of poverty, and seek refuge in you from the temptation of the Antichrist,

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ الْهَمِّ وَالْحُزْنِ وَالْعَجْزِ وَالْكَسَلِ وَالْبُخْلِ وَالْجُبْنِ وَضَلَعِ الدَّيْنِ وَغَلَبَةِ الرِّجَالِ
EngText: Allahumma inni a'udhu bika minal-hammi walhazani, wal'ajzi walkasali, walbukhli waljubni, wa dhala'id-dayni wa ghalabatir-rijaal .
EngTranslation: O Allah , I seek refuge in you from grief and sadness, from weakness and from laziness, from miserliness and from cowardice, from being overcome by debt and overpowered by men (i .e . others) .

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ إنِّي أعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ جَهْدِ الْبَلَاءِ، وَدَرَكِ الشَّقَاءِ، وَسُوءِ الْقَضَاءِ، وَشَمَاتَةِ الْأَعْدَا
EngText: Allahumma inni a'udhu bika min jahadil balaee, wadarkishshiqaae, wasooilqadaae, wa shamatitil aadaai
EngTranslation: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from the striving of calamity, the distress of misery, the misfortune of judgment, and the gloominess of the preparation

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْعَجْزِ وَالْكَسَلِ، ‏‏‏‏‏‏وَالْهَرَمِ، ‏‏‏‏‏‏وَالْبُخْلِ وَالْجُبْنِ،‏‏‏‏ وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ عَذَابِ الْقَبْرِ، ‏‏‏‏‏‏وَمِنْ فِتْنَةِ الْمَحْيَا وَالْمَمَاتِ
EngText: Allahumma inni a'udhu bika minal-'ajzi, wal-kasali, wal-harami, wal-bukhli, wal-jubni, wa 'audhu bika min 'adhabil-qabri, wa min fitnatil-mahya wal-mamati
EngTranslation: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from incapacity, laziness, old age, miserliness and cowardice, and I seek refuge in You from the torment of the grave, and from the trials of life and death

ArabicText:
اللّهُـمَّ إِنِّـي أَعـوذُ بِرِضـاكَ مِنْ سَخَطِـك ، وَبِمعـافاتِـكَ مِنْ
عُقوبَـتِك ، وَأَعـوذُ بِكَ مِنْـك ، لا أُحْصـي ثَنـاءً عَلَـيْك ، أَنْـتَ
كَمـا أَثْنَـيْتَ عَلـى نَفْسـِك
EngText: Allahumma inni a'udhu biridhaaka min sakhatika, wa bi mafaatika min 'uqoobatika wa 'a'udhu bika minka, laa 'ahsee sanaa'an 'alayka 'Anta kamaa 'asnayta 'alaa nafsika.
EngTranslation: O Allah, I seek protection in Your pleasure from Your anger, and I seek protection in Your forgiveness from Your punishment. I seek protection in You from You. I cannot count Your praises. You are as You have praised Yourself.

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْبَرَصِ وَالْجُنُونِ وَالْجُذَامِ وَمِنْ سَيِّئِ الأَسْقَامِ ‏‏
EngText: Allahumma inni a'udhu bika min al barsi wal junooni wal juzaami wamin saiee il asqaami
EngTranslation: O Allah, I seek refuge in Thee from leprosy, madness, elephantiasis, and evil diseases

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْهَدْمِ، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ التَّرَدِّي، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْغَرَقِ، وَالْحَرَقِ، وَالْهَرَمِ، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ أَنْ يَتَخَبَّطَنِيَ الشَّيْطَانُ عِنْدَ الْمَوْتِ، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ أَنْ أَمُوتَ فِي سَبِيلِكَ مُدْبِرًا، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ أَنْ أَمُوتَ لَدِيغًا
EngText: Allahumma inni a'udhu bika min al hadmi wa a'audhu bika minattaradi, wa  a'udhu bika min al gharaqi wal haraqi wal harami, wa a'udhu bika an yata khabbatanishaytaan indalmauti, wa a'udhu bika an amoota  fi sabeelika mudbira wa a'udhu bika an amoota ladeegha
EngTranslation: O Allah, I seek refuge in Thee from my house falling on me, I seek refuge in Thee from falling into an abyss, I seek refuge in Thee from drowning burning and decrepitude. I seek refuge in Thee from the devil harming me at the time of my death, I seek refuge in Thee from dying in Thy path while retreating, and I seek refuge in Thee from dying of the sting of a poisonous creature

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الجُوعِ، فإِنَّهُ بِئْسَ الضَّجيعُ، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ منَ الخِيانَةِ، فَإِنَّهَا بئْسَتِ البِطانَةُ
EngText: Allahumma inni a'udhu bika minal- ju'i, fa-innahu bi'sad-daji'u; wa a'udhu bika minal-khiyanati, fa- innaha bi'satil-bitanah
EngTranslation: O Allah! I seek refuge in You from hunger; surely, it is the worst companion. And I seek refuge in You from treachery; surely, it is a bad inner trait

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ إنِّي أعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ العَجْزِ، والكَسَلِ، والجُبْنِ، والبُخْلِ، والهَرَمِ، والقَسْوَةِ، والغَفْلَةِ، والعَيْلَةِ، والذِّلَّةِ، والمَسْكَنَةِ، وأعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الفَقْرِ، والكُفْرِ، والشِّرْك والفُسُوقِ، والشِّقاقِ، والنِّفاقِ، والسُّمْعَةِ، والرِّياءِ، وأعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الصَّمَمِ، والبَكَمِ، والجُنُونِ، والجُذامِ، والبَرَصِ، وَسَيِّىءِ الأَسْقامِ
EngText: Allahumma inni a'udhu bika min al ajzi wal kasali, wal jubni wal bukhuil, wal harmi wal qaswati wal ghaflati wal aeilati wazzilllati wal maskanati, wa'a'udhu bika minal faqr wal kufri  wasshirki  walfusuqi wasshiqaqi wannifaqi wassumati  warr riyaai', wa a'udhu bika minas sumoomi wal bakmi wal junooni wal juzaami wal barasi wassai al asqaami
EngTranslation: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from impotence and laziness, cowardice and miserliness, old age, cruelty, negligence, family, humiliation and misfortune, and I seek refuge in You from poverty, disbelief, immorality, discord, hypocrisy, reputation and hypocrisy.
HadithRef: رواه الحاكم في المستدرك على الصحيحين

ArabicText: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ زَوَالِ نِعْمَتِكَ, وَتَحَوُّلِ عَافِيَتِكَ, وَفَجْأَةِ نِقْمَتِكَ, وَجَمِيعِ سَخَطِكَ
EngText: Allahumma inni a'udhu bika min zawali niamateeka watahaulu aafiyatika wa fujaati niqmatiqa wa jameeyi saqtika
EngTranslation: O Allah! I seek refuge in you from the withholding of your favor, the decline of the good health you have given, the suddenness of your vengeance and from all forms of your wrath.

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ سَمْعِي، وَمِنْ شَرِّ بَصَرِي، وَمِنْ شَرِّ لِسَانِي، وَمِنْ شَرِّ قَلْبِي، وَمِنْ شَرِّ مَنِيِّي
EngText: Allahumma inni a'udhu bika min sharri samaee wa min sharri basari wa min sharri lisaani wa min sharri qalabi wa min sharri manniee
EngTranslation: O Allah, I seek refuge in Thee from the evil of what I hear, from the evil of what I see, from the evil of what I speak, from the evil of what I think, and from the evil of my semen" (i.e. sexual passion).
Chapter: Chapter: Regarding Seeking Refuge

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ جَارِ السُّوءِ فِي دَارِ الْمُقَامِ، فَإِنَّ جَارَ الدُّنْيَا يَتَحَوَّلُ‏
EngText: Allahumma inni a'udhu bika min jaaris-sui fidarril muqami fa inna jaarad-duniya yatahauualu
EngTranslation: Oh Allah, I seek refuge with you from an evil neighbour in the Eternal World. A neighbour in this world can be changed.
Chapter: Chapter: The bad neighbour

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا عَمِلْتُ وَمِنْ شَرِّ مَا لَمْ أَعْمَلْ
EngText: Allahumma, inni a'udhu bika min sharri ma 'amiltu wa min sharri ma lam a'mal
EngTranslation: O Allah, I seek refuge with You from the evil of what I have done, and from the evil of what I have not done yet
Chapter: Chapter: Seeking Refuge from the Evil of One's Actions, and Mentioning the Differences Reported from Hilal

ArabicText: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ غَلَبَةِ اَلدَّيْنِ, وَغَلَبَةِ اَلْعَدُوِّ, وَشَمَاتَةِ اَلْأَعْدَاءِ
EngText: Allahumma, inni a'udhu bika min ghalbatil dayyni wa ghalbatil aduvi wa shimatatil aadaaee
EngTranslation: O Allah! I seek refuge in you from the burden of debts and from being over-powered by men and from the gloating of enemies (at an evil I am afflicted with).” Related by
Chapter: The Comprehensive Book

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ عِلْمٍ لاَ يَنْفَعُ وَقَلْبٍ لاَ يَخْشَعُ وَدُعَاءٍ لاَ يُسْمَعُ وَنَفْسٍ لاَ تَشْبَعُ ‏"‏ ‏.‏ ثُمَّ يَقُولُ ‏"‏ اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ هَؤُلاَءِ الأَرْبَعِ
EngText: Allahumma inni a'udhu bika min 'ilmin la yanfa'u, wa qalbin la yakhsha'u, wa du'a'in la yasma'u, wa nafsin la tashba'u. Allahumma inni a'udhu bika min ha'ula'il-arba'
EngTranslation: O Allah, I seek refuge with You from knowledge that is of no benefit, a heart that is not humble, a supplication that is not heard and a soul that is not satisfied. O Allah, I seek refuge with You from these four.
Chapter: Chapter: Seeking Refuge from Opposing the Truth, Hypocrisy and Bad Manners

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ مُنْكَرَاتِ الأَخْلاَقِ وَالأَعْمَالِ وَالأَهْوَاءِ
EngText: Allāhumma innī a`ūdhu bika min munkarātil-akhlāqi wal-a`māli wal-ahwā
EngTranslation: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from evil character, evil actions, and evil desires
Chapter: Chapter: The Supplication Of Umm Salamah

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ الْعَفْوَ وَالْعَافِيَةَ فِي دِينِي وَدُنْيَاىَ وَأَهْلِي وَمَالِي
EngText: Allahumma inni as'alukal-'afwa wal-'afiyah fi dini wa dunyaya wa ahli wa mali.
EngTranslation: O Allah, I seek Your forgiveness and Your protection in my religion, in my worldly affairs, in my family and in my wealth.
Chapter: Chapter: In the morning and evening

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ إني أسألُك العافيةَ في الدنيا والآخرةِ
EngText: Allāhumma innī as'aluka 'l-`afwa wal-`āfiyata fid-dunyā wal-ākhirati,
EngTranslation: O Allah, I seek Your forgiveness and Your protection in this world and the next.
Chapter: Chapter: In the morning and evening

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ الْهُدَى، وَالتُّقَى، وَالْعَفَافَ، وَالْغِنَى
EngText: Allāhumma innī as'alukal huda wattaqa wal afafa wal ghina
EngTranslation: O Allah. I beg of Thee the right guidance, safeguard against evils, chastity and freedom from want.

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ مِنَ الْخَيْرِ كُلِّهِ عَاجِلِهِ وَآجِلِهِ مَا عَلِمْتُ مِنْهُ وَمَا لَمْ أَعْلَمْ وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الشَّرِّ كُلِّهِ عَاجِلِهِ وَآجِلِهِ مَا عَلِمْتُ مِنْهُ وَمَا لَمْ أَعْلَمْ
EngText: Allahumma inni as'aluka minal-khayri kullihi, 'ajilihi wa ajilihi, ma 'alimtu minhu wa ma la a'lam. Wa a'udhu bika minash-sharri kullihi, 'ajilihi wa ajilihi, ma 'alimtu minhu wa ma la a'lam.
EngTranslation: O Allah, I ask You for all that is good, in this world and in the Hereafter, what I know and what I do not know. O Allah, I seek refuge with You from all evil, in this world and in the Hereafter, what I know and what I do not know.

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ مِنْ خَيْرِ مَا سَأَلَكَ عَبْدُكَ وَنَبِيُّكَ وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا عَاذَ بِهِ عَبْدُكَ وَنَبِيُّكَ
EngText: Allahumma inni as'aluka min khayri ma sa'alaka 'abduka wa nabiyyuka, wa a'udhu bika min sharri ma 'adha bihi 'abduka wa nabiyyuka.
EngTranslation: O Allah, I ask You for the good that Your slave and Prophet has asked You for, and I seek refuge with You from the evil from which Your slave and Prophet sought refuge.

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ الْجَنَّةَ وَمَا قَرَّبَ إِلَيْهَا مِنْ قَوْلٍ أَوْ عَمَلٍ وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ النَّارِ وَمَا قَرَّبَ إِلَيْهَا مِنْ قَوْلٍ أَوْ عَمَلٍ وَأَسْأَلُكَ أَنْ تَجْعَلَ كُلَّ قَضَاءٍ قَضَيْتَهُ لِي خَيْرًا
EngText: Allahumma inni as'alukal-jannatah wa ma qarrab ilayha min qawlin aw 'amalin, wa a'udhu bika minan-nari wa ma qarraba ilayha min qawlin aw 'amalin, wa as'aluka an taj'al kulla qada'in qadaytahuli khayran
EngTranslation: O Allah, I ask You for Paradise and for that which brings one closer to it, in word and deed, and I seek refuge in You from Hell and from that which brings one closer to it, in word and deed. And I ask You to make every decree that You decree concerning me good

ArabicText:
اللّهُـمَّ إِنِّـي أَسْـأَلُـكَ خَشْيَتَـكَ في الغَـيْبِ
وَالشَّهـادَةِ، وَأَسْـأَلُـكَ كَلِمَـةَ الحَـقِّ في الرِّضـا وَالغَضَـب،
وَأَسْـأَلُـكَ القَصْدَ في الغِنـى وَالفَقْـر، وَأَسْـأَلُـكَ نَعـيماً لا
يَنْفَـد، وَأَسْـأَلُـكَ قُـرَّةَ عَيْـنٍ لا تَنْـقَطِعْ وَأَسْـأَلُـكَ
الرِّضـا بَعْـدَ القَضـاء، وَأَسْـأَلُـكَ بًـرْدَ الْعَـيْشِ بَعْـدَ
الْمَـوْت، وَأَسْـأَلُـكَ لَـذَّةَ النَّظَـرِ إِلـى وَجْـهِكَ وَالشَّـوْقَ
إِلـى لِقـائِـك، في غَـيرِ ضَـرّاءَ مُضِـرَّة، وَلا فِتْـنَةٍ مُضـلَّة،
EngText: Allaahumma 'innee 'as'aluka khashyataka fil-ghaybi wash-shahaadati, wa 'as'aluka kalimatal-haqqi fir-ridhaa walghadhabi, wa 'as'alukal-qasda fil-ghinaa walfaqri, wa 'as'aluka na'eeman laa yanfadu, wa 'as'aluka qurrata 'aynin laa tanqati'u, wa 'as'alukar-ridhaa ba'dal-qadhaa'i, wa 'as'aluka bardal-'ayshi ba'dal-mawti, wa 'as'aluka laththatan-nadhari 'ilaa wajhika wash-shawqa 'ilaa liqaa'ikafee ghayri dharraa'a mudhirratin wa laa fitnatin mudhillatin,
EngTranslation: O Allah , I ask You to grant me fear of You in private and in public . I ask you for the word of truth in times of contentment and anger . I ask You for moderation in wealth and in poverty . I ask you for blessings never ceasing and the coolness of my eye (i .e . pleasure) that never ends . I ask You for pleasure after Your Judgment and I ask You for a life of coolness after death . I ask You for the delight of gazing upon Your Face and the joy of meeting You without any harm and misleading trials befalling me.
Narrated By: Ziyad bin `Ilaqah narrated from his uncle
Chapter: Chapter: After the last tashahhud and before salam

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أسْألُكَ مِنْ كُلِّ خَيْر خزائِنُهُ بِيَدِكَ، وأعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ كُلِّ شَرَ خَزَائِنُهُ بِيَدِكَ
EngText: Alllahumm 'inni asaluka min kulli khayr khazayinuh biyadika, wa audh bika min kulli sharri khazayinuh biyadika
EngTranslation: O Allah, I ask for the best of  treasuries in your hand, and I seek refuge in You from all evil in your treasury

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ إنِّي أَسْأَلُك مِنْ فَضْلِكَ وَرَحْمَتِكَ، فَإِنَّهُ لاَ يَمْلِكُهَا إِلاَّ أَنْتَ
EngText: Allāhumma innī as'aluka min fazlika wa rahmatika fa innahu laa yamlikuha illa anta
EngTranslation: Oh Allah, I ask you of your grace and your mercy,For he does not possess it, but you

ArabicText: اللهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ الْجَنَّةَ وَمَا قَرَّبَ إِلَيْهَا مِنْ قَوْلٍ أَوْ عَمَلٍ، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ النَّارِ وَمَا قَرَّبَ إِلَيْهَا مِنْ قَوْلٍ أَوْ عَمَلٍ ، وَأَسْأَلُكَ أَنْ تَجْعَلَ كُلَّ قَضَاءٍ تَقْضِيهِ لِي خَيْرًا
EngText: Allahumma inni as'alukal-jannatah wa ma qarrab ilayha min qawlin aw 'amalin, wa a'udhu bika minan-nari wa ma qarraba ilayha min qawlin aw 'amalin, wa as'aluka an taj'al kulla qada'in qadaytahuli khayran
EngTranslation: O Allah, I ask You for Paradise and for that which brings one closer to it, in word and deed, and I seek refuge in You from Hell and from that which brings one closer to it, in word and deed. And I ask You to make every decree that You decree concerning me good
HadithRef: رواه أحمد في مسنده (24498) ، وابن ماجة في سننه (3846) ، وصححه الألباني في " صحيح الجامع " (1276)
Chapter: Chapters on Supplication

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ إِنَّا نَسْأَلُكَ مِنْ خَيْرِ مَا سَأَلَكَ مِنْهُ نَبِيُّكَ مُحَمَّدٌ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ ، وَنَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا اسْتَعَاذَ مِنْهُ نَبِيُّكَ مُحَمَّدٌ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ، وَأَنْتَ المُسْتَعَانُ، وَعَلَيْكَ البَلَاغُ، وَلَا حَوْلَ وَلَا قُوَّةَ إِلَّا بِاللَّهِ
EngText: Allāhumma innā nas’aluka min khairi mā sa’alaka minhu nabiyyuka Muḥammad, ṣallallāhu `alaihi wa sallam, wa na`ūdhu bika min sharri masta`ādha minhu nabiyyuka Muḥammad, ṣallallāhu `alaihi wa sallam, wa antal-musta`ānu wa `alaikal-balāgh, wa lā ḥawla wa lā quwwata illā billāh
EngTranslation: O Allah, we ask You from the good of what Your Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) asked You for, and we seek refuge in You from the evil of that which Your Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) sought refuge in You from, and You are the one from Whom aid is sought, and it is for You to fulfill, and there is no might or power except by Allah
HadithRef: فقد رواه الترمذي (3521) والبخاري في " الأدب المفرد " (679) ، وضعفه الألباني في "ضعيف الترمذي" .
Chapter: Jami` at-Tirmidhi » Chapters on Supplication

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ اغفِرْ لي خطيئَتي وجَهلي ، وإسرافي في أمري ، وما أنت أعلمُ به مني
EngText: Allahumaghfirli khtyyaty wjahly , wa'iisrafiun fi 'amriin , wama 'ant aelm bih miniy
EngTranslation: O Allah, forgive my faults, my ignorance, my immoderation in my concern. And you are better aware (of my affairs) than myself.

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ اغفرْ لي خطَئي وعَمْدي ، وهَزْلي وجِدِّي ، وكلُّ ذلك عندي
EngText: Allahummaghfirli khtayy wa amdy , whazly wjiddi , wkll dhlk eindi ,
EngTranslation: O Allah, grant me forgiveness (of the faults which I committed) seriously or otherwise (and which I committed) inadvertently and deliberately. All these (failings) are in me

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ اغفرْ لي ما قدَّمتُ وما أخَّرتُ ، وما أسررتُ وما أعلنتُ ، أنت المقدِّمُ وأنت المؤخِّرُ ، وأنت على كلِّ  شيء قديرٌ
EngText: Allhummaghfirli ma qddamt wama akhkhart , wama asrrt wama aelnt , 'ant almqddim wa'ant almwkhkhir , wa'ant ealaa kll shayeen' qadeer
EngTranslation: . O Allah, grant me forgiveness from the faults, which I did in haste or deferred, which I committed in privacy or in public and you are better aware (of them) than myself. You are the First and the Last and over all things you are Omnipotent.” Agreed Upon.

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِي خطَايَايَ وَذُنُوبِي كُلَّهَا،
EngText: Alllahumma aghfirli khtayay wadhunubi kullaha
EngTranslation: Oh Allah, forgive all of my sins.

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ أَنْعِمْنِي وَأَحْينِي وَارْزُقنِي، وَاهْدِنِي لِصَالِح الأعْمَالِ والأَخلاَقِ، إِنَّهُ لاَ يَهْدِي لِصَالِحِهَا إِلاَّ أَنْتَ، وَلاَ يَصْرِفُ عَنْ سَيئِهَا إِلاَّ أَنْتَ
EngText: Alllahumma 'aneimni wa'ahyni warzuqni, wahdini lisalih alaemal wal'akhlaaqi, 'innah la yahdi lisalihiha 'iila 'anta, wala yasrif ean sayyiha 'iila 'ant
EngTranslation: Oh Allah, bless me with long life

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ اجْعَلْ في قلبي نُوراً، وفِي بَصَرِي نُوراً، وفي سَمعِي نوراً، وعَنْ يميني نُوراً، وعَنْ يَسَارِي نُوراً، وفوقِي نُوراً، وتحتي نُوراً، وأمامي نُوراً، وخَلْفِي نُوراً واجْعَلْ لي نُوراً
EngText: Allāhumma aja'l fi qalbi nooran wa fi basri nooran wa fi sama'e nooran wa an yameeni nooran wa an yassari nooran wa fauqi nooran wa tahti nooran wa imami nooran wa khalfi nooran wa aja'l li nooran
EngTranslation: O Allah  Affliction, the distress of misery, the misfortune of the judiciary, and the gloating of the enemies

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ أَنْتَ خَلَقْتَ نَفْسِي وَأَنْتَ تتَوَفَّاها لَكَ مَمَاتُها وَمَحْيَاهَا إِنْ أَحْيَيْتَها فَأحْفَظْهَا وَإنْ أَمَتَّها فاغْفِرْلها
EngText: Allaahwmma 'innaka khalaqta nafsee wa 'Anta tawaffaahaa, laka mamaatuhaa wa mahyaahaa, 'in 'ahyaytahaa fahfadhhaa, wa 'in 'amattahaa faghfir lahaa . Allaahumma 'innee 'as'alukal-'aafiyata.
EngTranslation: O Allah, You have created my soul and You take it back. Unto You is its death and its life . If You give it life then protect it , and if You cause it to die then forgive it. O Allah, I ask You for strength.
Chapter: Chapter: Before sleeping

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ أَنْتَ رَبِّي لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ خَلَقْتَنِي وَأَنَا عَبْدُكَ وَأَنَا عَلَى عَهْدِكَ وَوَعْدِكَ مَا اسْتَطَعْتُ أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا صَنَعْتُ أَبُوءُ بِنِعْمَتِكَ وَأَبُوءُ بِذَنْبِي فَاغْفِرْ لِي إِنَّهُ لاَ يَغْفِرُ الذُّنُوبَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ
EngText: Allāhumma anta rabbi laa ilaha illa anta khalaqtani wa ana abduka wa ana ala aahdika wawadika mas tata'ata au
EngTranslation: O Allah, You are my Lord, there is no god but You. You have created me and I am Your slave and I am keeping my promise and covenant to You as much as I can. I seek refuge with You from the evil of what I do. I acknowledge Your blessing and I acknowledge my sin, so forgive me, for there is none who can forgive sin except You.

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ أَنْتَ رَبِّي لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ خَلَقْتَنِي وَأَنَا عَبْدُكَ وَأَنَا عَلَى عَهْدِكَ وَوَعْدِكَ مَا اسْتَطَعْتُ أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا صَنَعْتُ أَبُوءُ لَكَ بِنِعْمَتِكَ عَلَيَّ وَأَبُوءُ لَكَ بِذَنْبِي فَاغْفِرْ لِي فَإِنَّهُ لَا يَغْفِرُ الذُّنُوبَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ
EngText: Allahumma anta Rabbi la ilaha illa anta, Khalaqtani wa ana `Abduka, wa ana `ala `ahdika wa wa`dika mastata`tu, A`udhu bika min Sharri ma sana`tu, abu'u Laka bini`matika `alaiya, wa abu'u laka bidhanbi faghfir lee fa innahu la yaghfiru adhdhunuba illa anta
EngTranslation: O Allah! Thou art my Lord; there is no god but Thee, Thou hast created me, and I am Thy servant and hold to Thy covenant and promise as much as I can; I seek refuge in Thee from the evil of what I have done: I acknowledge Thy favour to me, and I acknowledge my sin; pardon me, for none but Thee pardons sins,
Chapter: Chapter: Afdal Al-Istighfar, Chapter: What to say when waking up

ArabicText: اللّهُـمَّ رَبَّ النَّاسِ  مذهب البأس، وَاشْفِ أَنْتَ الشَّافِي لَا شِفَاءَ إِلَّا شِفَاؤُكَ شِفَاءٌ لَا يُغَادِرُ سَقَمًا
EngText: Allahumma Rabban-nasi, mudh-hibal-ba'si, ishfi Antash-Shafi, la shafiya illa Anta, shifa'an la yughadiru saqaman
EngTranslation: O Allah! the Rubb of mankind! Take away this disease and cure (him or her). You are the Curer. There is no cure except through You. Cure (him or her), a cure that leaves no disease
Chapter: Chapter: Supplication for the Sick

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ رَبَّ جِبْرَائِيلَ وَمِيكَائِيلَ وَرَبَّ إِسْرَافِيلَ أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ حَرِّ النَّارِ وَمِنْ عَذَابِ الْقَبْرِ
EngText: Allahumma, rabba jibra'ila, wa mika'ila wa rabba israfila, a'udhu bika min harrin-nari wa (min) 'adhabil-qabr
EngTranslation: O Allah, Lord of Jibra'il and Mika'il and Lord of Israfil, I seek refuge in You from the heat of the Fire and (from) the torment of the grave.
Chapter: Chapter: Seeking Refuge from the Heat of the Fire

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ رَبَّ السَّمَوَاتِ وَرَبَّ الأَرْضِ وَرَبَّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيمِ رَبَّنَا وَرَبَّ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ فَالِقَ الْحَبِّ وَالنَّوَى وَمُنْزِلَ التَّوْرَاةِ وَالإِنْجِيلِ وَالْفُرْقَانِ أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ أَنْتَ آخِذٌ بِنَاصِيَتِهِ
EngText: Allāhumma rabbas-samawati wa rabbal-aradi wa rabbal arshil azeem, rabbana warabba kulli shayeen faleeqal habbi wannawa wa munzilat-tawratah wal injeeli wal furqaan, audhu bika min sharri kulli shayeen anta aakhiz bi naasiyateeh,
EngTranslation: O Allah. the Lord of the Heavens and the Lord of the Earth and Lord of the Magnificent Throne, our Lord, and the Lord of evervthina, the Splitter of the grain of corn and the datestone (or fruit kernal), the Revealer of Torah and Injil (Bible) and Criterion (the Holy Qur'an), I seek refuge in Thee from the evil of every- thing Thou art to sieze by the forelock (Thou hast perfect control over it).
Chapter: Chapter: Supplication When Going To Sleep

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ أَنْتَ الأَوَّلُ فَلَيْسَ قَبْلَكَ شَىْءٌ وَأَنْتَ الآخِرُ فَلَيْسَ بَعْدَكَ شَىْءٌ وَأَنْتَ الظَّاهِرُ فَلَيْسَ فَوْقَكَ شَىْءٌ وَأَنْتَ الْبَاطِنُ فَلَيْسَ دُونَكَ شَىْءٌ اقْضِ عَنَّا الدَّيْنَ وَأَغْنِنَا مِنَ الْفَقْرِ
EngText: Allahumma anta awwalu falaisa qablika shayeen wa anta aakhiru falaisa baadaka shayeen wa antaz-zahiru falaisa fauqaka shayeen wa anta baatinu falaisa doonaka sahyeen akhzee anna-dayna wa aghnina minal faqr
EngTranslation: O Allah, Thou art the First, there is naught before Thee, and Thou art the Last and there is naught after Thee, and Thou art Evident and there is nothing above Thee, and Thou art Innermost and there is nothing beyond Thee. Remove the burden of debt from us and relieve us from want.
Chapter: Chapter: Supplication When Going To Sleep

ArabicText: اَللَّهُمَّ أَحْيِنِيْ مَاْ كَاْنَتِ الْحَيَاةُ خَيْراً لِيْ وَتَوَفَّنِيْ مَاْ كَاْنَتِ الْوَفَاْةُ خَيْراً لِيْ
EngText: Allāhumma ahyeeni ma kaanatal hayatu khairalli wa tawaffani maa kaanatil wafaati khairalli
EngTranslation: O Allah, give me life as long as life is better for me, and take me when death is better for me

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ أَحْيِنِي مِسْكِينًا ، وَأَمِتْنِي مِسْكِينًا ، وَاحْشُرْنِي فِي زُمْرَةِ الْمَسَاكِينِ
EngText: Allāhumma ahyeeni miskeenan wa amtani miskeenan wah-sharni fi zumratil masaakeen
EngTranslation: O Allah, cause me to live poor and cause me to die poor, and gather me among the poor (on the Day of Resurrection

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ أَسْلَمْتُ نَفْسِي إِلَيْكَ، وَوَجَّهْتُ وَجْهِي إِلَيْكَ وَفَوَّضْتُ أَمْرِي إِلَيْكَ، وَأَلْجَأْتُ ظَهْرِي إِلَيْكَ، رَغْبَةً وَرَهْبَةً إِلَيْكَ، لاَ مَلْجَأَ وَلاَ مَنْجَا مِنْكَ إِلاَّ إِلَيْكَ، آمَنْتُ بِكِتَابِكَ الَّذِي أَنْزَلْتَ، وَبِنَبِيِّكَ الَّذِي أَرْسَلْتَ
EngText: Allahum 'aslamt nafsi 'iilayka, wawajaht wajhi 'iilayka, wafawadt 'amri 'iilayka, wa'aljat zahri 'iilayki, raghbatan warahbat 'iilayka, laa malja wala manjaa mink 'iilaa 'iilyk‏.‏ amanat bikitabik aldhy 'unzilat ‏.‏ wanubik aldhy 'arsalat
EngTranslation: Oh Allah, I surrendered myself to you, and directed my face to you, entrusted my affairs to you, and I sought refuge in you, a desire and awe to you, there is no refuge nor a deliverance from you except to you.

ArabicText: اللَّهمَّ لَكَ أسْلَمْتُ وبِكَ آمنْتُ، وعليكَ توَكَّلْتُ، وإلَيكَ أنَبْتُ، وبِكَ خاصَمْتُ.
EngText: Allahuma laka 'aslamtu wa bika aamantu wa-alaika tawakkaltu wa 'iilayka,  anbatu wa bika khasamtu,
EngTranslation: O Allah, it is unto Thee that I surrender myself. I affirm my faith in Thee and repose my trust in Thee and turn to Thee in repentance and with Thy help fought my adversaries
HadithRef: متفقٌ عَلَيهِ وَهَذا لَفْظُ مُسْلِمٍ وَاخْتَصرهُ الْبُخَارِيُ
Chapter: The Book Pertaining to the Remembrance of Allah, Supplication, Repentance and Seeking Forgiveness

ArabicText: اللَّهمَّ أعُوذُ بِعِزَّتِكَ، لا إلَه إلاَّ أنْتَ أنْ تُضِلَّنِي أنْت الْحيُّ الَّذي لاَ تمُوتُ، وَالْجِنُّ وَالإِنْسُ يمُوتُونَ
EngText: Allahumma audhu bi-izzatika laa ilaha illa antaa an tu-zillani antal hayeeul-lazi laa tamutoo wal jinnu wal insu yamutoon
EngTranslation: O Allah, I seek refuge in Thee with Thine Power; there is no god but Thou, lest Thou leadest me astray. Thou art ever-living that dieth not, while the Jinn and mankind die
HadithRef: متفقٌ عَلَيهِ وَهَذا لَفْظُ مُسْلِمٍ وَاخْتَصرهُ الْبُخَارِيُ
Chapter: The Book Pertaining to the Remembrance of Allah, Supplication, Repentance and Seeking Forgiveness

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ لَكَ الحَمْدُ ، أَنْتَ نُورُ السَّمَوَاتِ وَالأَرْضِ وَمَنْ فِيهِنَّ ، وَلَكَ الحَمْدُ ، أَنْتَ قَيِّمُ السَّمَوَاتِ وَالأَرْضِ وَمَنْ فِيهِنَّ ، وَلَكَ الحَمْدُ ، أَنْتَ الحَقُّ ، وَوَعْدُكَ حَقٌّ ، وَقَوْلُكَ حَقٌّ ، وَلِقَاؤُكَ حَقٌّ ، وَالجَنَّةُ حَقٌّ ، وَالنَّارُ حَقٌّ ، وَالسَّاعَةُ حَقٌّ ، وَالنَّبِيُّونَ حَقٌّ ، وَمُحَمَّدٌ حَقٌّ ، اللَّهُمَّ لَكَ أَسْلَمْتُ ، وَعَلَيْكَ تَوَكَّلْتُ ، وَبِكَ آمَنْتُ ، وَإِلَيْكَ أَنَبْتُ ، وَبِكَ خَاصَمْتُ ، وَإِلَيْكَ حَاكَمْتُ ، فَاغْفِرْ لِي مَا قَدَّمْتُ وَمَا أَخَّرْتُ ، وَمَا أَسْرَرْتُ وَمَا أَعْلَنْتُ ، أَنْتَ المُقَدِّمُ وَأَنْتَ المُؤَخِّرُ ، لاَ إِلَهَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ
EngText: Alllahumma lakalhamd , 'anta nurus- samawati wal'ardi waman fihinna , walak-alhamd , 'anta qayimus-samaawati wal'ardi waman fi-hinna, walakalhamd, 'antalhaqq, wawadaka haqq, waqawluka haqq, waliqawuka haqq, waljannatu haqq, wannaru haqq, was-saatu haqq,  wan-nabiuwna haqq , wamuhammadun haqq, Alllahumma laka 'aslamt, wa alayika tawakkaltu, wabika amantu, wa'iilayka 'anbatu, wabika khasamtu, wa'iilayka hakamtu, faghfirli ma qaddamtu wama 'akhkhartu, wama 'asrartu wama 'aalantu , 'antal muqaddim wa'antal muakkhir , la 'iilaha 'illa 'ant
EngTranslation: Oh Allah, you praise, you are the light of the heavens and the earth, and in them, and you praise, you heavens values ​​and earth, and in them, and you praise, you are right, Uadk right, you say the right, and meeting your right, paradise right, right shot, and at the right, and the prophets are right, and Mohammed right , Oh God, I converted to Islam, and you trust, and hast believed, and you sprouted, and your Khasamt, and you tried, so forgive me what made and delayed, and what Osrrt and announced, you submitted and you backside, no God but you
Chapter: Sahih Muslim » The Book of Prayer - Travellers

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ اغْسِلْ عَنِّي خَطَايَاىَ بِمَاءِ الثَّلْجِ وَالْبَرَدِ، وَنَقِّ قَلْبِي مِنَ الْخَطَايَا، كَمَا نَقَّيْتَ الثَّوْبَ الأَبْيَضَ مِنَ الدَّنَسِ، وَبَاعِدْ بَيْنِي وَبَيْنَ خَطَايَاىَ كَمَا بَاعَدْتَ بَيْنَ الْمَشْرِقِ وَالْمَغْرِب ‏
EngText: Allahummaghsil anni khatayaya bima'ith-thalji wal-baradi wa naqqil qalabi minal-khataya kama naqqaitath-thawbal-abyada min ad-danasi, wa ba'id baini wa baina khatayaya kama ba'adta bainal-mashriqi wal-maghrib.
EngTranslation: O Allah, wash my sins by the waters of snow and hail, Purify my heart from sins, just as you refine the white robe from unclean(Just as you cleaned the white garment from impure), O Allah, put a great distance between me and my sins, as great as the distance You have made between the East and the West.

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ أَصْلِحْ لِي دِينِي الَّذِي هُوَ عِصْمَةُ أَمْرِي، وَأَصْلِحْ لِي دُنْيَايَ الَّتِي فِيهَا مَعَاشِي، وَأَصْلِحْ لِي آخِرَتِي الَّتِي فِيهَا مَعَادِي، وَاجْعَلِ الْحَيَاةَ زِيَادَةً لِي فِي كُلِّ خَيْرٍ، وَاجْعَلِ الْمَوْتَ رَاحَةً لِي مِنْ كُلِّ شَرٍّ
EngText: Alllahumm 'aslih li dini alladhi hu eismat 'amri, wa'aslih li dunyay allati fiha maeashi, wa'aslih li akhirati allati fiha maeadi, wajeal alhayat ziadatan li fi kull khayrin, wajeal almawt rahatan li min kull sharr
EngTranslation: O Allah! Set right for me my religion, which is the safeguard of my affairs. And set right for me the affairs of the world wherein is my living. Decree the Hereafter to be good for me. And make this life, for me, (a source) of abundance for every good and make my death (a source) of comfort to me and protection against every evil

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ احْفَظنِي بالإِسْلاَمِ قائِماً، واحْفَظْنِي بالإِسْلاَمِ قاعِداً، واحْفَظنِي بالإِسْلاَمِ راقِداً، ولا تُشْمِتْ بِي عَدُوّاً ولا حاسِداً
EngText: Alllahumm ahfazni bal' islaam qayimaan, wahfazni bal' islaam qaeidaan, wahfazni bal' islaam raqidaan, wala tushmit bi aduwwaan wala hasidaan
EngTranslation: O Allah! Protect me with Islam when standing, and protect me with Islam when sitting down, and protect me with Islam when reclining, and do not make an enemy or envier rejoice at me.

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ اسْتُرْ  عَوْرَاتِي وَآمِنْ رَوْعَاتِي ،
EngText: Allahum-mastur 'awrati, wa amin raw'ati,
EngTranslation: O Allah! conceal my fault or faults, and keep me safe from the things which I fear;
Chapter: Chapter: In the morning and evening

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ احْفَظْنِي مِنْ بَيْنِ يَدَيَّ ، وَمِنْ خَلْفِي ، وَعَنْ يَمِينِي ، وَعَنْ شِمَالِي ، وَمِنْ فَوْقِي ، وَأَعُوذُ بِعَظَمَتِكَ أَنْ أُغْتَالَ مِنْ تَحْتِي
EngText: Allahumma ahfazni min bayni yadayya, wa min khalfi, wa 'an yamini wa 'an shimali, wa min fawqi,wa 'audhu bi azmati, wa 'audhu bika an ughtala min tahti
EngTranslation: O Allah! guard me from evil which is  in front of me and behind me, on my right hand and on my left, and from above me: and I seek in Thy greatness from receiving unexpected harm from below me.
Chapter: Chapter: In the morning and evening

ArabicText:
اللّهُـمَّ بِعِلْـمِكَ الغَـيْبِ وَقُـدْرَتِـكَ عَلـى الْخَلقِ أَحْـيِني ما
عَلِـمْتَ الحـياةَ خَـيْراً لـي، وَتَوَفَّـني إِذا عَلِـمْتَ الوَفـاةَ
خَـيْراً لـي
EngText: Allaahumma bi'ilmikal-ghayb wa qudratika 'alal-khalqi 'ahyinee maa 'alimtal-hayaata khayran lee wa tawaffanee 'ithaa 'alimtal-wafaata khayran lee
EngTranslation: O Allah, by Your Knowledge of the unseen and by Your Power over creation , let me live if You know that life is good for me , and let me die if You know that death is good for me
Narrated By: Ziyad bin `Ilaqah narrated from his uncle
Chapter: Chapter: After the last tashahhud and before salam

ArabicText: اللّهُـمَّ زَيِّـنّا بِزينَـةِ الإيـمان، وَاجْـعَلنا هُـداةً مُهْـتَدين
EngText: Allaahumma zayyinnaa bi zeenatil-'eemaan waj'alnaa hudaatan muhtadeen.
EngTranslation: O Allah, dress us with the beauty of Faith , and make us guides who are upon (correct) guidance.
Narrated By: Ziyad bin `Ilaqah narrated from his uncle
Chapter: Chapter: After the last tashahhud and before salam

ArabicText: اَللَّهُمَّ كَمَا أَحْسَنْتَ خَلْقِي, فَحَسِّنْ خُلُقِ
EngText: Allahumma kama aahsanta khalaki, fa-hassin khulkhi
EngTranslation: O Allah You have made my creation perfect, so make my moral characteristics also be the best.”
Chapter: The Comprehensive Book

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ مُصَرِّفَ الْقُلُوبِ صَرِّفْ قُلُوبَنَا عَلَى طَاعَتِكَ ‏
EngText: Allahumma mussarifull-quloobi sarrif quloobana ala taatika
EngTranslation: 0 Allah, the Turner of the hearts, turn our hearts to Thine obedience.
Narrated By: Narrated by Abdullah b. Amr b. al-'As
Chapter: Chapter: Allah Directs Hearts As He Wills

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ أَعِـنِّي عَلـى ذِكْـرِكَ وَشُكْـرِك ، وَحُسْـنِ عِبـادَتِـك
EngText: Allaahumma 'a'innee 'alaa zikrika, wa shukrika, wahusni 'ibaadatika.
EngTranslation: O Allah, help me to remember You, to give You thanks , and to perform Your worship in the best manner.

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ اقْسِمْ لَنَا مِنْ خَشْيَتِكَ مَا تَحُولُ بِهِ بَيْنَنَا وَبَيْنَ مَعَاصِيكَ، وَمِنْ طَاعَتِكَ مَا تُبَلِّغُنَا بِهِ جَنَّتَكَ، وَمِنَ الْيَقِينِ مَا تُهَوِّنُ بِهِ عَلَيْنَا مَصَائِبَ الدُّنْيَا، اللَّهُمَّ مَتِّعْنَا بِأَسْمَاعِنَا، وَأَبْصَارِنَا، وَقُوَّاتِنَا مَا أَحْيَيْتَنَا، وَاجْعَلْهُ الْوَارِثَ مِنَّا، وَاجْعَلْ ثَأْرَنَا عَلَى مَنْ ظَلَمَنَا، وَانْصُرْنَا عَلَى مَنْ عَادَانَا، وَلَا تَجْعَلْ مُصِيبَتَنَا فِي دِينِنَا، وَلَا تَجْعَلِ الدُّنْيَا أَكْبَرَ هَمِّنَا، وَلَا مَبْلَغَ عِلْمِنَا، وَلَا تُسَلِّطْ عَلَيْنَا مَنْ لَا يَرْحَمُنَا
EngText: Allahumma-qsim Lana Min Khadhaitika Wa Yahuwlu, Bainana Wa Baina Ma’asika Wa Min Ta’atika Ma Tuballighuna Bihi Jannataka Wa Minal-Yaqini, Ma Tuhawwinu Bihi Alaina Musibatid-Dunya Wa Matti’na Bi-Asma’ina Wa Absarina, WA Quwwatina Ma Ahyaytana WAj’alhul-Waritha Minna Waj’al Tha’rana Ala Man Zalamana Wansurna Ala Man Adana Wa La Taj’al Musibatana Fi Dinina Wa La Taj’alid-Dunya Akbara Hammina Wa La Mublagha Ilmina Wa La Tusallit Alaina Man La Yarhamuna
EngTranslation: ‘O Allah, apportion for us, fear of You, that shall come between us and disobedience of You, and of obedience to You, which shall cause us to obtain Your Paradise, and of certainty, which shall make the afflictions of the world easy for us, and enjoyment of our hearing, and our seeing, and our strength as long as You keep us alive, and make it the inheritor of us. And let our vengeance be upon those who have wronged us, and aid us against those who show enmity towards us, and do not make our affliction in our religion, and do not make this world our greatest concern, nor the limit of our knowledge, and do not give power over us to those who will not have mercy on us.

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ امَتِّعْنِي بِسَمْعِي وَبَصَرِي، وَاجْعَلْهُمَا الْوَارِثَ مِنِّي، وَانْصُرْنِي عَلَى عَدُوِّي، وَأَرِنِي مِنْهُ ثَأْرِي‏.‏
EngText: Allahumma matti'ani bisam'e wa basari waj'alhumal warisa minni wansurni ala aduvvi wa-arni minhu saa'ri
EngTranslation: O Allah, let me enjoy my sight and hearing and make them remain sound until I die. Turn away my enemy and grant me revenge on him.

ArabicText: اللَّهُمَّ لَا تَكِلْنِي  إلى نَفْسِي طَرْفَةَ عَيْنٍ أَبَدًا
EngText: Allahumma la Takilni ila Nafsi tarfata Aaynin Abda
EngTranslation: O Allah Never  leave me in charge of my Nafs (my self)  even for a blink of an eye
UrduTranslation: اے اللہ  کبھی بھی پلک جھپکنے کے برابر مجھے میرے نفس کے حوالے نہ کر
